thread.title: Chuck Todd to Clinton Campaign Manager: Where Was All This Liberal Energy Last Year?
thread.title_full: Chuck Todd to Clinton Campaign Manager: Where Was All This Liberal Energy Last Year?

author: Josh Feldman
title: Chuck Todd to Clinton Campaign Manager: Where Was All This Liberal Energy Last Year?
text:
Chuck Todd to Clinton Campaign Manager: Where Was All This Liberal Energy Last Year? by Josh Feldman | 6:04   video 
Chuck Todd faced off with Clinton campaign manager Robby Mook today over what his campaign got wrong and where all this liberal energy was last year. 
He pointed to this huge anti-Trump resistance that’s exploded on the left since the inauguration, and he asked Mook, “Were was this energy on the Democratic side… when it might have been useful?” 
Mook conceded that a big problem was them taking too much for granted, which led to people feeling safe enough to go third-party or not vote at all. And now that Donald Trump is the president, people need to focus their efforts on pressuring Congress to stop the “very disturbing things” he wants. 
Todd pointed out that some people might resist such calls to action from “establishment” figures like himself, and he asked Mook if the Clinton campaign made a mistake in focusing too much on the analytics. 
After all, Todd noted, there was a “failure of imagination” on the part of the press to imagine a path to victory for Trump. Mook conceded that may have been true of them too, but still pointed to that infamous FBI letter. 
Watch the full segment above, via MSNBC.
